org.jetel.data.tape

Class DataRecordTape

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.tape.DataRecordTape

  • public class DataRecordTape
extends java.lang.Object
    Data structure for storing records in chunks on local disk (in temporary file).
    When the data object is closed - the physical representation (the file) is removed - i.e. no permanent storage is performed.
    Each chunk registers how many records is stored in it. The number of chunks on tape(in file) is not limited. Records can be read only sequentially, but particular chunk can be selected.

    Usage:
    tape=new DataRecordTape();
    tape.open();
    tape.addDataChunk();
    ..loop.. tape.put(..data..);
    tape.addDataChunk();
    ..loop.. tape.put(..data..);
    tape.rewind();
    ..loop..tape.get();
    tape.nextChunk();
    ..loop..tape.get();
    tape.close();
    Since:
    20.1.2005

        Parameters:
        tmpFileName - Name of the temp file or NULL (the system default temp directory and name will be used)
        dataBufferSize - The size of internal in memory buffer. If smaller than DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE, then default is used

      • rewind

        public void rewind(boolean doFlush)
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                   java.io.IOException

        Rewinds the buffer and makes first chunk active. Next get operation returns first record stored in first chunk. Allows preventing flush (see doFlush param.) that block concurrency in some situations.

        Flush shall be done if there were some data written to the tape.

        Parameters:
        doFlush - true if flush shall be done,
        false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        September 19, 2002

      • rewind

        public void rewind()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • clearBuffer

        public void clearBuffer()
        Clears the internal buffer.

        This method should be used before storing additional data records after all data records stored on the tape were read.

        Code fragment: 

           tape.addDataChunk();
   REPEAT tape.put(record);

   tape.rewind();
   REPEAT tape.get(record);

   tape.clearBuffer();
   REPEAT tape.put(record);

      • clear

        public void clear()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Clears the tape. All DataChunks are destroyed. Underlying tmp file is truncated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException

      • nextDataChunk

        public boolean nextDataChunk()
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Sets next data chunk active. Next get() operation will return first record from the newly activated chunk. This method must be called after rewind() method, otherwise the result is not guaranteed.
        Returns:
        true if next data chunk has been activated, otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.IOException

      • get

        public boolean get(CloverBuffer data)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Fills buffer passed as an argument with data read from current data chunk. Must not be mixed with put() method calls, otherwise the result is not guaranteed.
        The normal way of using this method is:
        while(get(data)){ ... do something ... }
        Parameters:
        data - buffer into which store data
        Returns:
        true if success, otherwise false (chunk contains no more data).
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
